p: Viruses of the Orbivirus genus, in the Reoviridae family, infect plants and vertebrates, and are characterized by a dsRNA genome of 10â€“12 segments. Tibet orbivirus (TIBOV) was isolated from Anopheles maculatus collected in China [ 58]. TIBOV was cultured from mosquito extract inoculated on C6/36 and BHK-21 cells. Cytopathic effects characterized by cell rounding, lysis, and floating cells were observed only in the BHK-21 cells after 3 d of infection, but viral RNA was detected by RT-PCR in both cell types. Gel electrophoresis revealed ten dsRNA genome segments, which were sequenced [ 58]. An. maculatus species are important vectors of human malaria in Asia [ 114].
